articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Belarusian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Belarusian President
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Aleksandr Grigoriyevich Lukashenko, president of Belarus, on its national day.
					The message wished the President success in his work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of its people.

articles.title: Greetings to Belarusian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Belarusian FM
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Sunday sent a message of greeting to his Belarusian counterpart Sergei Martinov on its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, wishing him success in his work.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Flails S. Korean Warmongers' Provocation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Flails S. Korean Warmongers' Provocation
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The reckless provocative moves, now being made by the south Korean warmongers against the DPRK, remind one of the "north expedition" racket traitor Syngman Rhee kicked off just before provoking the past war against the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is working hard to realize the wild ambition Syngman Rhee failed to do, the article says, adding:
					
					 The puppet warmongers committed such military provocations as the "Cheonan" warship sinking case and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident. In the meantime they have frequently staged large-scale joint military exercises against the DPRK, inviting to south Korea dangerous nuclear offensive means of the U.S. such as nuclear-powered aircraft carriers and submarines.
					
					 The Lee group is now planning to stage an extremely provocative drill for "stability in the north and handover of government to civilians there" by mobilizing riffraffs of the "five provincial offices of the north" in the forthcoming Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercise.
					
					 Meanwhile the group is indiscriminately cracking down upon non-governmental organizations opposed to the "government's" policy of confrontation with the fellow countrymen and its scheme to ignite a war against the DPRK. It stretched out its hand of repression even to the military while launching a sweeping purge campaign against patriotic and conscientious people.
					
					 What the group seeks in such moves is to unleash a war of aggression on the DPRK and realize "unification under the system of liberal democracy," a treacherous attempt. That is why it is clamoring about "contingency" and conducting military rehearsals almost every day after rounding off war scenarios to cope with it.
					
					 Recently the group perpetrated again never-to-be-condoned hideous provocation after the incident of target that hurt the dignity of the DPRK's leadership. The facts show that its anti-DPRK war moves have gone far beyond the limit line of danger.
					
					 It is clear what disaster the entire nation would suffer if this group of traitors is allowed to go wild to do harm to the compatriots.
					
					 It is deserved to dislodge the Lee group, source of national disaster, without delay.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Displacing People for Development Project
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced  for Displacing People for Development Project 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Organizations of the poor in south Korea denounced the authorities for threatening the life of the poor through their development project. They held a rally in front of the Posin Pavilion in Seoul on June 29.
					 The authorities dishoused the poor in different parts of the city under the pretext of the development, speakers said.
					
					 The authorities are sacrificing the poor in hand with construction entrepreneurs, they deplored.
					
					 They called upon all the people to go in solidarity with the poor in their struggle to stop the unreasonable development by the authorities and thus overturn at an early date the society where the privileged lord it over.

articles.title: Actions for Judging Lee Myung Bak Regime Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Judging Lee Myung Bak Regime Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean preparatory committee for the People's Strength for Building New World held an all-people rally in Seoul on June 29 to judge the Lee Myung Bak regime for deteriorating the people's livelihood.
					Attending it were workers, farmers, students and other masses of different social standings, at least 10,000 in all.
					
					 Kim Yong Hun, chairman of the Confederation of Trade Unions, Ri Kwang Sok, chairman of the Federation of Peasants Associations, Pak Ja Un, chairperson of the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century, spoke at the rally.
					
					 The authorities are ruthlessly violating the vital rights of the workers, indifferent to the developments at the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd. and the Yusong Enterprise, the speakers charged.
					
					 There is no room to retreat any longer as the regime uses violence against people calling for their vital rights and there is no way but to take actions to meet their demands, they stressed.
					
					 Calling for demonstrating the strength of all the people through the overall anti-"government" struggle, they demanded the authorities raise minimum wage, halve registration fee, stop the suppression of the labor movement, ensure the basic labor right, revise the Law on Trade Unions and stop the moves for the conclusion of the "Free Trade Agreement" with the U.S.
					
					 The participants staged a demonstration.
					
					 That day the fascist police deployed more than 9,000 repressive forces of 114 companies around the venues of the rally and demonstration, creating terror-ridden atmosphere.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Legal Reparation for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Legal Reparation for Sexual Slavery
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The 975th Wednesday rally for the settlement of the issue of "comfort women" for the Japanese Imperial Army took place in Seoul on June 29 under the sponsorship of the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society in south Korea.
					 Present there were victims to the sexual slavery, civic and social organizations in south Korea and a trade union in Japan.
					
					 A statement read out at the rally said not only south Koreans of different social standings but the international community demand Japan take responsibility for the crimes related to sexual slavery and make legal reparation for them.
					
					 The statement accused the Japanese government of still refusing official apology and reparation to the victims.
					
					 It urged the Japanese authorities to take immediate measures for apology and reparation for Japan's past crimes.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime should also take responsible diplomatic attitude toward the settlement of the "comfort women" issue, it stressed.

articles.title: Pro-Reunification Activist Convicted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Pro-Reunification Activist Convicted in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Seoul High Court of south Korea convicted pro-reunification activist Rev. Han Sang Ryol of crimes at a trial on an appeal on June 30. He visited Pyongyang last year on the 10th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 The court charged that he violated the "National Security Law".

articles.title: Seminars in Mexico, Guinea Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Death Anniversary
articles.content:
Seminars in Mexico, Guinea Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Death Anniversary
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and the youth study group and the Morelos Branch under it, the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea between June 22 and 24 on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Kim Il Sung was a distinguished thinker and theoretician, outstanding strategist, great statesman and people's leader who founded the Juche idea, the Songun idea and led the Korean revolution and global independence to victory, Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, said.
					
					 Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised Kim Il Sung as the peerlessly great man and the sun of all people who worked heart and soul for the victory of global independence, holding high the banner of independence.
					
					 Camano Vitor, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea, explained and proved the originality, validity and invincible vitality of the Juche idea founded by the President and developed in depth by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. The idea is a perfect revolutionary idea to be maintained by the popular masses in the future, too, he added.

articles.title: Solidarity for Korean People's Struggle Expressed in Pakistan
articles.content:
Solidarity for Korean People's Struggle Expressed in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- 11 Pakistani political parties and organizations issued a joint statement on June 27 on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people. They included the Sind Provincial Committee of the Labor Party, the Karachi Branch of the People's Party, the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance, the Karachi Juche Study Center and the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association.
					 Tension is constantly running high on the Korean Peninsula due to the aggression moves by the U.S. imperialists and their stooges, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean authorities are becoming all the more pronounced in their moves against the DPRK typified by military exercises and political and economic pressure put on it.
					
					 We condemn the U.S. imperialists' moves to ignite a war to dominate the whole of Korea as an encroachment upon the sovereignty of the Korean people and a big threat to the peace in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 We stress once again that the anti-U.S. struggle is a common task facing progressive mankind.
					
					 If the U.S. truly wants the reunification and peace of Korea, it should drop its hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for responding to the DPRK's proposal for the replacement of the armistice agreement with a peace one.
					
					 World progressives should conduct the positive solidarity movement for supporting the Korean people in their struggle to get the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea and reunify the country.
					
					 We call upon the world peace-loving people and democratic forces to express solidarity with the Korean people's struggle. We demand the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop at once the war moves.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea issued a bulletin on June 27 to commemorate the 17th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "President Kim Il Sung, Peerlessly Great Man" said the Korean people have become the most dignified people in the world and the DPRK has shed its rays as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence as they are holding him in high esteem.
					
					The President's cause of building a rich country has been successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, it added.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has further consolidated the DPRK's status as a politico-ideological and military power while wisely leading the Korean people in their struggle to build a prosperous and powerful nation, stressed the bulletin.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association in its bulletin on June 23 elaborated on Kim Jong Il's successful visit to China with his photo meeting with Hu Jintao.
					
					 The bulletin carried the full text of the statement issued by a spokesman for the National Defence Commission of the DPRK on May 30 and an article denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' moves to escalate confrontation with the DPRK. It also introduced the association's activities for the development of relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Visit to China Hailed by Indonesian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Visit to China Hailed by Indonesian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian National Federation of Transport Workers Unions hailed General Secretary Kim Jong Il's successful visit to China in a statement on June 27.
					 His visit to China was an epochal event of weighty significance in boosting the DPRK-China friendship generation after generation, defending the peace and stability in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and more confidently advancing the socialist cause, the human cause of independence, the statement said.
					
					 It praised him as a distinguished leader in the present times who is steering the development of not only the traditional DPRK-China friendly relations but the international relations and the most veteran political elder and peerlessly great man who is pushing forward the triumphant advance of the human cause of independence.
					
					 It sincerely wished the Korean people bigger success in the struggle to build a thriving nation and reunify the country independently and peacefully under his leadership.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan and Nigerian newspapers carried special write-ups on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on June 26 edited an article titled "Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea" with his photo.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is the father of socialist Korea which is demonstrating its might as a political and ideological power, a military power and a scientific and technological power in the world, the article said.
					
					 The feats of the President who built the genuine people's country and the man-centred socialist system with his original idea of state building and veteran and tested leadership will shine long, it noted.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on June 22 praised the great life of the President who put forward the idea of global independence and devoted his all to building an independent new world.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Mexican Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Mexican Party Leader
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, issued a statement on June 25 on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 All the Korean people and progressive mankind pay the highest respect to the President in recognition of his undying contributions to the cause of the popular masses for independence and look back with emotion on his great life in humble reverence on the anniversary of his demise, the statement said.
					
					 It praised him as the benefactor of the liberation of the Korean people and their tender-hearted father and great leader.
					
					 It is quite natural that the Korean people are holding him in high esteem as the eternal leader even after he passed away, it noted.
					
					 We pay profound homage once again to Kim Il Sung who is always alive in the hearts of the world progressive mankind and wholeheartedly wish good health for General Secretary Kim Jong Il who is glorifying the President's revolutionary idea and undying feats, it added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Off Press in Brazil
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Young People Must Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Upholding the Leadership of the Party" was brought out in booklet by the Eco Copia Publishing House of Brazil on June 28.
					 The work is a letter sent by the President to the 8th Congress of the then League of Socialist Working Youth of Korea on February 22, Juche 82 (1993). It clarifies the successful role played by the Korean youth as the vanguard of the revolution and the tasks and ways for the youth in carrying forward and accomplishing the Korean revolution generation after generation.

articles.title: Japanese Stand against Re-operation of Nuclear Plants
articles.content:
Japanese Stand against Re-operation of Nuclear Plants
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Japanese are getting stronger in the stand against the re-operation of nuclear power plants now in shutdown.
					 According to the results of nationwide opinion poll published in Japan on June 27, about 70 percent of the respondents expressed opposition to the re-operation of those nuclear plants.

articles.title: Speech Made by Hu Jintao at Meeting Celebrating CPC Anniversary
articles.content:
Speech Made by Hu Jintao at Meeting Celebrating CPC Anniversary
 Beijing, July 2 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, made a speech at a meeting celebrating the 90th founding anniversary of the Communist Party of China Friday.
					 He said:
					
					 In 1921, the CPC was born in the process of integrating Marxism-Leninism with the Chinese workers' movement. The birth of the CPC put the Chinese revolution on the right course, gave the Chinese people a powerful motivation and created bright prospects for China's future development.
					
					 Looking back at China's development and progress over the past 90 years, we have naturally come to this basic conclusion: Success in China hinges on the Party.
					
					 To make Party building more scientific under the new historical conditions, we must raise the ideological and political awareness of the whole Party, encourage outstanding individuals in all fields to join the cause of the Party and country, maintain close ties between the Party and the people and uphold integrity and combat corruption.
					
					 Since the very day of its founding, the CPC has heroically shouldered the historic mission of uniting with and leading the people in achieving the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation. In pursuing this great cause, we must unswervingly follow the basic line of the Party, promote scientific development, enhance social harmony and make overall progress in the great cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics from the new historical starting point. 
					
					 We must firmly follow the line, principles, and policies adopted since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Party Central Committee and apply the spirit of reform and innovation to all aspects of government administration.
					
					 We should properly handle conflicts among the people and other social conflicts. We should reduce and defuse these conflicts by building the material basis, enhancing moral strength, improving policies and measures, and providing a stronger institutional guarantee.
					
					 The army should fulfill its historic mission in the new stage in the new century. We should intensify efforts to build a revolutionary, modern, and standardized army in an all-around way and strengthen and develop unity between the army and the government and between the army and the people.
					
					 We should pursue the general goal of promoting peaceful development of relations across the Taiwan Strait, deepen exchanges and cooperation in all areas and expand interactions across the Strait. We should join hands in opposing and checking separatist activities for "Taiwan independence" and work for the happiness of compatriots on both sides of the Strait and the future of the Chinese nation.
					
					 We will continue to pursue an independent foreign policy of peace and unswervingly follow the path of peaceful development and the win-win strategy of opening up.
					
					 The whole Party must care about young people, listen to what they have to say, encourage their growth, and support their entrepreneurship.
					
					 All the achievements of the Party over the past 90 years have been made by the Party together with the people.
					
					 In the first half of this century, the Party will unite with and lead the people in accomplishing two grand goals: First, to build a moderately prosperous society of a higher level to the benefit of over one billion people by the centennial of the founding of the CPC and, second, to make China a prosperous, strong, democratic, culturally advanced and harmonious modern socialist country by the centennial of the founding of New China.
					
					 All the comrades in the Party must keep in mind their historic missions. We must unswervingly forge ahead along the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics and work even harder to unite with and lead the people of all ethnic groups in China in working for our happy life and the bright future of the Chinese nation.

articles.title: China Will Ensure Safety of Universiad--Senior Official
articles.content:
China Will Ensure Safety of Universiad--Senior Official 
						
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, state councilor and minister of Public Security of China, recently called for successfully ensuring the 26th World Student Summer Games.
					 After hearing a report on the work of security for the Universiad in Shenzhen, he stressed the need to provide safe social environment for successful holding of the games by inheriting the excellent traditions of the Communist Party of China, fully displaying the political advantage of the socialist system and consulting experience gained in ensuring the security in important events.

articles.title: Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Railway Opens to Traffic in China
articles.content:
Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Railway Opens to Traffic in China
Beijing, July 2 (KCNA) -- The 300 kph Beijing-Shanghai high-speed railway was formally opened to traffic in China with due ceremony in Beijing on June 30.
					The 1 318-kilometer-long railway links the country's two regions via Tianjin City and Hebei, Shandong, Anhui and Jiangsu provinces.

articles.title: Month for Tour of Revolutionary Sites Goes on in China
articles.content:
Month for Tour of Revolutionary Sites Goes on in China
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- A month for tour of revolutionary sites is going on in China to celebrate the 90th birthday of the Communist Party of China. It began on June 23.
					 The tour started in Jiaxing City, Zhejiang Province, where the CPC was founded and will last until July 23 via Hunan and Hebei provinces.
					
					 In this period there will be such events as collection of writings and photos under the theme of "landscape of revolutionary tourist areas."

articles.title: Sudanese President Visits China
articles.content:
Sudanese President Visits China
 Beijing, July 2 (KCNA) -- Sudanese President Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir visited China from June 28 to 30.
					 During the visit he had talks with Chinese President Hu Jintao. He also met and had conversations separately with Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, and Li Keqiang, vice-premier of the State Council.
					
					 At the talks and conversations they exchanged views on the matter of boosting bilateral relations and issues of mutual concern.
					
					 A series of agreements were signed between the two countries
					
					 The Sudanese president toured Shandong Province of China.

articles.title: Russia Rejects West's Clumsy Trick
articles.content:
Russia Rejects West's Clumsy Trick
						
 Moscow, July 1 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov rejected the West's sinister craft on June 30 when addressing a meeting of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma.
					 The West is trying to lead changed international situation in its favor through regime change in some countries disagreeable to it, he noted, adding that Russia stands against this trickery.
					
					 Such attempt can never be supported, he said, calling for obedience to the international laws.

articles.title: Iran Ready to Counter US "Internet in Briefcase" Plan
articles.content:
Iran Ready to Counter US "Internet in Briefcase" Plan
						
 Tehran, July 2 (KCNA) -- Iranian Intelligence Minister said Wednesday that his country is already prepared to counter the U.S. President Barack Obama's "Internet in briefcase" plan.
					The Iranian intelligence minister said that the project of "Internet in briefcase" is developed to counter the Islamic Republic specifically.
					
					 Iran's army and people are fully ready to counter the U.S. cyber attack and will shatter any move at one stroke, he stressed.

articles.title: Iran Allows Russian Experts to Study US Drones
articles.content:
Iran Allows Russian Experts to Study US Drones 
 Tehran, July 1 (KCNA) -- Iran allowed Russian experts to study the two latest drones of the 5th U.S. Fleet, which were shot down early in January this year.
					 This step was taken at the Russian request, according to a high-ranking officer of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps of Iran.

articles.title: Brazilian Elected New FAO Director-General
articles.content:
Brazilian Elected New FAO Director-General 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Jose Graziano da Silva, professor of Brazil, was elected as the new director-general of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization through voting recently held at its headquarters.

articles.title: Algeria Refutes US Accusations
articles.content:
Algeria Refutes US Accusations
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The chairperson of the National Consultative Commission for the Promotion and Protection of Human Rights of Algeria in an interview with state-run radio on June 29 refuted the U.S. accusations against the country.
					 Recently the U.S. included Algeria in the list of countries with the flesh traffic while slandering that it still remains unreached in the elementary international standards.
					
					 The chairperson termed the U.S. accusations unfairness as they were unreasonable, saying that such attitudes taken by the U.S. are aimed at defiling Algeria in the international arena.
